presenting_symptoms: Burning chest pain in center of chest, worse after meals and when lying down. Episodes last 15-30 minutes. Present for 1 week. No radiation.
vital_signs: Temperature 37.0Â°C, HR 82, BP 128/78, RR 16, O2 sat 99% on room air
physical_exam: Alert and oriented. Cardiovascular: regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, rubs or gallops. Pulmonary: clear to auscultation bilaterally. Abdomen: soft, non-tender, no guarding. No reproducible chest wall tenderness.
past_medical_history: Gastroesophageal reflux disease diagnosed 2 years ago, anxiety disorder
social_history: Never smoker, occasional alcohol use (1-2 drinks per week), works as teacher
family_history: Mother had myocardial infarction at age 72, father with hypertension

review_of_systems.constitutional: No fever, fatigue, or weight loss
review_of_systems.respiratory: No cough, no shortness of breath
review_of_systems.gastrointestinal: Frequent heartburn, worse when lying down after meals, occasional regurgitation of sour taste
review_of_systems.other: Reports increased work stress in the past month

imaging.ecg: Normal sinus rhythm. No ST or T wave abnormalities.
